about_the_game:
In this roguelike deckbuilder, you cut the cards... literally! With scissors! You can recombine the cut-outs to form new cards, and you can play your custom cards in combat or in text-based dialogue events. The game has a custom language processing engine that will determine the special effects of each new card you make.
(Note: This game does not use generative AI.)

Features:

  • Hundreds of cards. You can mix-and-match effects from different cards using a unique card-cutting mechanic. There are endless possibilities of what you can make!

  • Play your cards even outside of combat. Special purple options appear during dialogue if you have a card that could be useful. These options usually give you additional rewards. Carefully consider how to balance your deck between combat and non-combat cards to successfully traverse the continent.

  • Nonlinear exploration in a randomly generated map. Each time you play, a new map with different arrangements of biomes, settlements, and rivers is generated. You can choose to backtrack, but you'll have to keep an eye on your rations. The maps are displayed in a hand-drawn style (and if you want an authentic version without colors, you can choose that in settings!)

  • Card battles with physics-based simulations. When you shoot arrows at an enemy, there's not just a generic slashing animation. Instead, arrows fly out towards your enemy and collide (or not!) with them.

  • Complex elemental system. Each enemy has their own vulnerabilities, resistances, and immunities. If you try to attack an enemy wearing chainmail with a dagger, it won't be so effective. But try shocking them with lightning, and it might just double the damage!

linux_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Ubuntu 22.04 or later, or compatible
  • Processor: 2.0 GHz or higher
  • Memory: 2 GB RAM
  • Graphics: At least 1 GB VRAM with Vulkan 1.0 support
  • Storage: 5 GB available space

mac_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: macOS Monterey or later
  • Processor: Apple M1 or Intel Core M or better
  • Memory: 2 GB RAM
  • Graphics: At least 1 GB VRAM with Vulkan 1.0 or Metal support
  • Storage: 5 GB available space
